سونیا سوتو مایور کو 2009 میں مقرر کیا گی: When was Sonia Sotomayor appointed? Sonia Sotomayor appointment year

Sonia Maria Sotomayor (/ˈsoʊnjə ˌsoʊtoʊmaɪˈjɔːr/, Spanish: [ˈsonja sotomaˈʝoɾ]; born June 25, 1954) is an American lawyer and jurist who serves as an associate justice of the Supreme Court of the United States. She was nominated by President Barack Obama on May 26, 2009, and has served since August 8, 2009.
When was Sonia Sotomayor appointed? Sonia Sotomayor appointment year
She was nominated by President Barack Obama on May 26, 2009, and has served since August 8, 2009. She is the third woman, the first Hispanic, and the first Latina to serve on the Supreme Court.
سونیا سوتو مایور کو امریکی سپریم کورٹ می: Who appointed Sonia Sotomayor to the US Supreme Court? Sonia Sotomayor US Supreme Court appointment

سونیا سوتو مایور کو صدر براک اوباما نے م: Who appointed Sonia Sotomayor? Sonia Sotomayor appointed by Barack Obama
Who appointed Sonia Sotomayor? Sonia Sotomayor appointed by Barack Obama

President Obama commissioned Sotomayor a justice of the Supreme Court on August 6, the same day as her confirmation. Her swearing-in ceremony took place two days later, on August 8, at the Supreme Court Building.
سونیا سوتو مایور کو صدر براک اوباما نے 2: Who appointed Sonia Sotomayor in 2009? Sonia Sotomayor appointment 2009
She was nominated by President Barack Obama on May 26, 2009, and has served since August 8, 2009. She is the third woman, the first Hispanic, and the first Latina to serve on the Supreme Court.
Who appointed Sonia Sotomayor in 2009? Sonia Sotomayor appointment 2009

The Senate confirmed Sonia Sotomayor to be an associate justice of the Supreme Court on August 6, 2009, by a vote of 68–31. The Senate was composed of 58 Democrats, 2 independents who caucused with the Democrats, and 40 Republicans at the time.
